intro: Maesa dunniana, commonly known as the dwarf maesa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
